s0001.literal: Emperor Zhao the Filial was Emperor Wu's youngest son.
s0001.idiomatic: Emperor Zhao the Filial was Emperor Wu's youngest son.

s0002.literal: His mother was Consort Zhao, who originally obtained favor because of extraordinary qualities, and when she gave birth to the Emperor, it was also extraordinary.
s0002.idiomatic: His mother was Consort Zhao, who originally gained the emperor's favor due to her extraordinary qualities; when she gave birth to the emperor, it was also extraordinary.

s0003.literal: The account is in the Biography of Outer Relatives.
s0003.idiomatic: The full account is in the Biography of the Imperial Relatives by Marriage.

s0004.idiomatic: The Emperor was five years old when Emperor Wu passed away.

s0005.literal: 戊寅，太子即皇帝位，謁高廟。
s0005.idiomatic: On the day Wuyin, the crown prince ascended the imperial throne and paid respects at the Gao Temple.

s0006.literal: 尊皇太后曰太皇太后，皇后曰皇太后。
s0006.idiomatic: He honored the Empress Dowager as Grand Empress Dowager, and the Empress as Empress Dowager.

s0007.idiomatic: Summer, sixth month, granted amnesty to the world.

s0008.literal: 秋七月，庚申，封皇后父奉光侯洨為右扶風，爵如故。
s0008.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, day Gengshen, enfeoffed the Empress's father Marquis Fengguang Hao as Right Prefect of Fufeng, with his marquisate as before.

s0009.literal: 九月，詔曰：「朕以眇身獲保宗廟，戰戰兢兢，惟恐不稱。
s0009.idiomatic: Ninth month, edict said: 'I, with my insignificant person, have obtained the protection of the ancestral temples; I am fearful and cautious, afraid of not being worthy.

s0010.idiomatic: The common people have not yet understood my intentions.

s0011.literal: 惟民之繫心念想，咸惠以申思，免今歲田租。
s0011.idiomatic: The people's hearts are bound up with anxious thoughts; I wish to extend favor to express my thoughts, so I exempt this year's land taxes.'

s0012.literal: 二年春正月，賜民爵一級。
s0012.idiomatic: Second year, spring, first month, granted the people nobility ranks of one level.

s0014.idiomatic: Second month, day Yichou, the Emperor plowed at Fu Chu.

s0015.literal: 三月，詔曰：「朕之不逮，咎在厥躬。
s0015.idiomatic: Third month, edict said: 'My shortcomings are due to my own faults.

s0016.literal: 乃者廣廷講學，稽古建厲，以崇禮義，厥功茂焉。
s0016.idiomatic: Recently in the broad court we conducted academic lectures, investigated antiquity to establish moral principles, exalting ritual and righteousness—their merit has been abundant.

s0017.literal: 其賜中二千石以下至吏民爵，各有差。
s0017.idiomatic: Grant to those from 2000 shi officials and below, down to officials and commoners, nobility ranks according to their respective degrees.'

s0018.literal: 夏四月，詔曰：「朕以眇身奉承祖宗，夙夜惟念，孝心恆結。
s0018.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, edict said: 'I, with my insignificant person, receive the legacy of my ancestors; day and night I think only of this, my filial heart is constantly bound.

s0019.literal: 中外之輔，忠愛尤著，海內鄉風，百姓歸德。
s0019.idiomatic: The inner and outer assistants have been especially loyal and loving; the realm looks to this example, the people return to virtue.

s0020.literal: 惟功德茂盛，暨臻于治，復博選賢俊，宣譽厥德。
s0020.idiomatic: Their merit and virtue are abundant, bringing us to good governance; moreover, I have broadly selected worthy talents to proclaim their virtue.

s0021.literal: 其與中二千石、博士議郎，錄功臣後嗣，咸以所聞。」
s0021.idiomatic: Let them together with the 2000 shi officials and Erudites discuss recording the descendants of meritorious officials, all according to what they have heard.'

s0022.idiomatic: Sixth month, granted amnesty to the world.

s0023.literal: 三年春正月，泰山有大石自起立。
s0023.idiomatic: Third year, spring, first month, at Mount Tai a large stone rose up by itself.

s0024.literal: 上林有柳樹斷枯卧地，亦自立生。
s0024.idiomatic: In the Shanglin Gardens a willow tree that was broken and lying withered on the ground also stood up and came back to life.

s0025.literal: 二月，詔曰：「朕承先帝之休烈，夙夜戰慄，以保宗廟。
s0025.idiomatic: Second month, edict said: 'I inherit the blessed achievements of my predecessor emperors; day and night I tremble with fear to preserve the ancestral temples.

s0026.literal: 惟念百姓未贍，前年減漕三百萬石，米貴民貧。
s0026.idiomatic: I think only of the people not being satisfied; last year we reduced the tribute grain by three million shi; grain is expensive and the people are poor.

s0028.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, granted amnesty to the world.

s0029.literal: 六月，詔曰：「蓋聞龍言之君，必有明察之佐。
s0029.idiomatic: Sixth month, edict said: 'I have heard that a sage ruler must have perceptive assistants.

s0030.literal: 故夏殷周政，咸建賢材，胥和百姓。
s0030.idiomatic: Therefore the governments of Xia, Shang, and Zhou all established worthy talents, bringing harmony to the people.

s0031.literal: 朕承宗廟，兢兢業業，惟恐弗逮。
s0031.idiomatic: I inherit the ancestral temples, working diligently and cautiously, fearing I may not be adequate.

s0032.idiomatic: The common people have not yet understood my intentions.

s0033.literal: 惟民之繫心，咸惠以申思。
s0033.idiomatic: The people's hearts are bound; I wish to extend favor to express my thoughts.

s0034.literal: 其賜中二千石以下至吏民爵，各有差。」
s0034.idiomatic: Grant to those from 2000 shi officials and below, down to officials and commoners, nobility ranks according to their respective degrees.'

s0035.literal: 秋七月，詔曰：「朕以眇身，獲保宗廟，戰戰兢兢，惟恐不稱。
s0035.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, edict said: 'I, with my insignificant person, have obtained the protection of the ancestral temples; I am fearful and cautious, afraid of not being worthy.

s0036.literal: 百姓未贍，前年減漕，米尚糴貴。
s0036.idiomatic: The people are not yet satisfied; last year we reduced the tribute grain, yet grain is still expensive to buy.

s0037.idiomatic: Reduce the poll tax money for the world.'

s0038.literal: 八月，詔曰：「往年災害多，今年羣穀豊熟。
s0038.idiomatic: Eighth month, edict said: 'In previous years disasters were many; this year the various grains are abundantly ripe.

s0039.literal: 惟遣使者赍帛祠行水旱災處，存問百姓。
s0039.idiomatic: I will dispatch envoys bearing silk to offer sacrifices at places affected by floods and droughts, and to inquire after the people's welfare.

s0040.literal: 鰥寡孤獨老弱不能自存者，賜帛二匹。」
s0040.idiomatic: For widowers, widows, orphans, the solitary, the elderly and weak who cannot support themselves, grant two bolts of silk.'

s0041.literal: 九月，大鴻臚靳石謁見匈奴單于。
s0041.idiomatic: Ninth month, the Grand Herald Jin Shi paid respects to the Xiongnu Chanyu.

s0042.literal: 四年春正月，賜中二千石以下至吏民爵，各有差。
s0042.idiomatic: Fourth year, spring, first month, granted nobility ranks to those from 2000 shi officials and below, down to officials and commoners, each according to their degree.

s0043.idiomatic: Second month, granted amnesty to the world.

s0044.literal: 夏四月，詔曰：「朕承先帝休烈，夙夜戰慄，懼弗稱嗣。
s0044.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, edict said: 'I inherit the blessed achievements of my predecessor emperor; day and night I tremble with fear, afraid of not being worthy of succession.

s0045.literal: 惟百姓未贍，前年減漕三百萬石，米貴民貧。
s0045.idiomatic: The people are not yet satisfied; last year we reduced the tribute grain by three million shi; grain is expensive and the people are poor.

s0047.idiomatic: Sixth month, granted amnesty to the world.

s0048.literal: 秋八月，詔曰：「往年比災害，民未嘗贍也。
s0048.idiomatic: Autumn, eighth month, edict said: 'In previous years disasters followed one after another; the people have never been satisfied.

s0049.literal: 其遣使者循行郡國，存問耆老、鰥寡孤獨、不能自存者，餽穀帛有差。」
s0049.idiomatic: Dispatch envoys to tour the commanderies and kingdoms, inquiring after the elderly, widowers, widows, orphans, and the solitary who cannot support themselves, granting grain and silk according to their needs.'

s0050.idiomatic: Fifth year, spring, first month, granted amnesty to the world.

s0051.literal: 二月，詔曰：「朕以眇身，奉承祖宗，深惟百姓未贍，前年減漕，米尚糴貴。
s0051.idiomatic: Second month, edict said: 'I, with my insignificant person, receive the legacy of my ancestors; I deeply consider that the people are not yet satisfied; last year we reduced the tribute grain, yet grain is still expensive to buy.

s0053.idiomatic: Summer, the Yangling fields were narrow; mobilized the people to station troops.

s0054.idiomatic: Sixth month, granted amnesty to the world.

s0055.idiomatic: Autumn, seventh month, great rain; the Wei Bridge broke.

s0056.literal: 八月，詔曰：「今歲郡國熟，榖賤，取爵賜如前。」
s0056.idiomatic: Eighth month, edict said: 'This year the commanderies and kingdoms have good harvests; grain is cheap. Take nobility ranks and grant as before.'

s0057.literal: 九月，詔曰：「朕以眇身，獲保宗廟，戰戰兢兢，惟恐不稱。
s0057.idiomatic: Ninth month, edict said: 'I, with my insignificant person, have obtained the protection of the ancestral temples; I am fearful and cautious, afraid of not being worthy.

s0058.idiomatic: This year hungry people have fled to the wilderness; I am ashamed.

s0059.idiomatic: Reduce the poll tax money for the world.'

s0060.idiomatic: Sixth year, spring, first month, granted amnesty to the world.

s0061.literal: 二月，詔曰：「蓋聞古者祖宗之君，豫建太子，所以重社稷也。
s0061.idiomatic: Second month, edict said: 'I have heard that in ancient times the ancestral rulers established crown princes in advance, so as to value the altars of soil and grain.

s0062.literal: 朕承宗廟，戰戰兢兢，惧弗稱嗣。
s0062.idiomatic: I inherit the ancestral temples, fearful and cautious, afraid of not being worthy of succession.

s0063.literal: 惟前孝武皇帝早弃天下，朕稚沖孺，未能親政。
s0063.idiomatic: Previously Emperor Wu the Filial abandoned the world early; I was young and immature, unable to personally govern.

s0064.literal: 其廣延博選，舉賢聖之材，立太子以安宗廟。」
s0064.idiomatic: Broadly extend and extensively select, raise worthy and sage talents, establish a crown prince to secure the ancestral temples.'

s0065.idiomatic: Summer, fourth month, granted amnesty to the world.

s0066.idiomatic: Sixth month, granted amnesty to the world.

s0067.literal: 秋八月，詔曰：「往年比災害，民未嘗贍。
s0067.idiomatic: Autumn, eighth month, edict said: 'In previous years disasters followed one after another; the people have never been satisfied.

s0068.literal: 其遣使者存問老弱鰥寡孤獨，賜谷帛有差。」
s0068.idiomatic: Dispatch envoys to inquire after the elderly, weak, widowers, widows, orphans, and solitary, granting grain and silk according to their needs.'

s0069.literal: 九月，大司馬大將軍霍光稽首歸政。
s0069.idiomatic: Ninth month, Grand Marshal Grand General Huo Guang bowed his head and returned the government.

s0070.literal: 上褒讚曰：「大司馬大將軍忠信勇篤，祿位永元。」
s0070.idiomatic: The Emperor praised him, saying: 'The Grand Marshal Grand General is loyal, trustworthy, brave, and steadfast; his emoluments and position shall be eternally enduring.'

s0071.idiomatic: Seventh year, spring, first month, granted amnesty to the world.

s0072.literal: 二月，詔曰：「朕承宗廟之休，戰戰兢兢，惟恐不稱。
s0072.idiomatic: Second month, edict said: 'I inherit the blessed fortune of the ancestral temples; I am fearful and cautious, afraid of not being worthy.
